ablation noun
(OF TISSUE)
[ C or U ]
  medical
  specialized a medical treatment that involves cutting away or destroying a small amount of tissue from the body, for example using heat or cold: The hospital was one of the first institutions to use radiofrequency ablation on kidney tumours. Minimally invasive surgical ablations use the latest technology to enable surgeons to perform surgeries through needle-sized holes. See also
cardiac ablation
RFA
More examplesFewer examplesAblation is the intentional destruction of tissue, usually with heat. In most ablations the quantity of tissue affected is minuscule.In catheter ablation a tiny probe is threaded through the arteries to the interior of the heart, where it zaps a few cells that have occasionally been making the heart beat too fast.
